intro: Ochradenus gifrii, commonly known as the Jordanian spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Ochradenus gifrii is often found in dry, open habitats and is considered a resilient species in its native range.
